VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Shopping relative to the peak of Transportation in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Shopping is to the {left} of the peak of Transportation.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Dining} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =43.5?
EVJ.A: At X =43.5,the label with the highest density is {Dining}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 3880? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Nightlife}'s peak at {4789},{Transportation}'s peak at {4314},{Adventure Activities}'s peak at {8619},{Sightseeing}'s peak at {8398}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 5520? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Shopping}'s peak at {2683},{Nightlife}'s peak at {4789},{Dining}'s peak at {1031},{Transportation}'s peak at {4314}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Shopping or Transportation?
NC.A: {Transportation} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Sightseeing or Transportation?
NC.A: {Sightseeing} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Adventure Activities or Nightlife?
NC.A: {Adventure Activities} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Dining}
